entry.title: Weekly Readings
entry.content:
• History of Apache Storm and Lessons Learned

Great reading. One thing I learned is thinking carefully at the very beginning to overcome outstanding other solutions. It also means the key technology can happen at a very eary stage.

  • Invertiable Bloom Lookup Tables

This is a paper I'd like to read long times ago. It reminds me when I attend the presentation of WWW'14 best paper: Efficient Estimation for High Similarities using Odd Sketches [pdf | slides ] (It aims to compute Jarcard Similarity when two sets are very similar to each other.)

  • Effective GoF Patterns with C++ 11 and Boost

This is a detailed implementation of modern GoF pattern. I planned to type each example and learn.

  • Data Structure and Algorithms for Big Databases

This is a presenation of various I/O efficient algorithm in the model of external I/O model.
